DataElement.preferredName: Person Type 1 Diabetes Related Autoimmune Disease Personal Medical History Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._Diabetes mellitus characterized by insulin deficiency, sudden onset, severe hyperglycemia, rapid progression to ketoacidosis, and death unless treated with insulin. The disease may occur at any age, but is most common in childhood or adolescence._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis)._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

Property.preferredName: Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus Relationship Autoimmune Disease Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Diabetes mellitus characterized by insulin deficiency, sudden onset, severe hyperglycemia, rapid progression to ketoacidosis, and death unless treated with insulin. The disease may occur at any age, but is most common in childhood or adolescence.:Related; connected or associated.:A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A chronic condition characterized by minimal or absent production of insulin by the pancreas.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
